author: Fred Massabki
comment: Love it, specifically the overall minimalism, the reminder feature, that it syncs with Android Wear, and can be added to the notification tiles.  Only feature that seems missing is ability to include a long break option (for lunch).  You have to pay for the ability to adjust the work/break duration settings, but it is worth it and helps support a developer who has long contributed to the Android development community. One issue, which I'll email developer about, is with the update I get reminders on my watch every minute, unless I deactivate the sync.

reply.author: Francisco Franco
reply.content: Hi. Version 4.0 has an option for custom timers.

author: Debopriyo Basu
comment: I got a promo code for this app earlier. It became free for all and now the custom timer is a paid feature. Isn't there any way to unlock the feature for those who have it in the purchase history of their Google account?

author: Christopher Uga
comment: For some reason, the app won't keep running on my phone. I'm not sure why, and at this point I've stopped trying.   The developer reached out to me to see if it would work for me on the latest update. It still doesn't, but seeing an attempt by the developer to please a dissatisfied customer is always nice, so I'm improving my review, even if I still can't get the app to work.

reply.author: Francisco Franco
reply.content: Hi Christopher. That's not the experience I want you to have. Can you update to version 4.0.1 and let me know if it still occurs? Thank you!

author: Tom Goulding
comment: Brilliant app for productivity, responsive and friendly developer.  I would love this to have IFTTT support in future (so that when I start a cycle it automatically plays my work playlist on spotify)

reply.author: Francisco Franco
reply.content: Hi Tom. Check version 2.0, there's a little treat for you there ;)

author: Periklis F
comment: Simple and applies the necessary pressure. Does it's job. The developer is the best guy ever.

author: Dilius Khaliullin
comment: Adding custom cycle time would be great :3

author: Sudamma Soh
comment: Playful sound is playing with phone notification sound simultaneously... Please fix... App is awesome! Great job!

author: patzedlr
comment: It's really helpful!

author: Kevin Jain
comment: Simple, minimal, does the job! 👍

author: Luis Cortes
comment: New update with custom timers is great. A must have for those behind a desk all day and certain time breaks. Thanks a bunch Franco.

reply.author: Francisco Franco
reply.content: Hi Agustín. Really glad you're happy with 5217, thanks!

author: R. Batinic
comment: 5$ for custom timers after i already bought the app, wow...talking about greed...

reply.author: Francisco Franco
reply.content: Hi R. Batinic. Send me an e-mail with your purchase receipt! :)

author: sugaraj rajamanickam
comment: Really an awesome app for productivity.. But i am suggesting a small improvement though. That is " instead of 52 fixed minutes it will be great if the amount time for working and relaxing can be programmed as per our wish". Because i have read several type of work cycles that can be efficient and i would like to try them too. You can limit the minimum productivity time as 52 and break as 20.. If this feature is already available, then please point out how to do it.

reply.author: Francisco Franco
reply.content: Hi. Version 4.0 has an option for custom timers.

author: Erick Rodriguez
comment: Response response: alright I'll give you a 4 star since you seem to care.  Response: but it's on active ram. So it consumes battery and slow down the phone. I have multiple apps running in the background. Eventually everything gets slower. Always on ram even when not in use. Why?

reply.author: Francisco Franco
reply.content: As I already said, Android has its own memory management system. When 5217 is being used during a cycle it needs a permanent service which consumes in the range of 5-10mb, when the cycle ends and the service is shutdown Android deals with it as it pleases (probably cached). It doesn't consume any battery and it doesn't slow down your phone.

author: sagar rai
comment: It often freezes and does not update. Sometimes it's stuck at the last minute of work session and when it refreshes you realize half the break time is gone because it didn't refresh. Some work sessions don't show up in stats. It's a good idea but unreliable app.

author: Andro Almario
comment: After latest update, time on notification and in app are not synchronized. Sometimes notification will say I have 10 minute break left, but app will show 52 minutes and blue screen as if I haven't started a cycle.  edit- Developer responded quickly. Issue isn't a huge deal, and I still love the app.

reply.author: Francisco Franco
reply.content: Super wierd. I'll try to reproduce.

author: m al
comment: Good app. A suggestion: allow to add personal time periods! I usually study in 40 min. sessions, and take 10 min. breaks. So it'd be helpful if I can add my own time period! Plz add this feature, I'm giving it 5★s.

author: Kyle Morgan
comment: I love getting alerts when it's time to take a break and when it's time to get back to work. I would love to have a "lunch break" option though. For example, if I'm about to take a 60 minute lunch break, I'd like a new cycle to start after my lunch break so I don't forget.

author: Federico Santamorena
comment: perfect, remember that the screen doesn't turn on automatically, so if you disabled the Media audio no notification will appear, you need to go into the settings and enable it

author: Jeremy Swank
comment: The app works well except for the LED notification feature found in the settings. The 5217 notification light still blinks while the timer is running. From the description, this option should turn off all LED notifications from blinking.

author: Akshit jain
comment: Does this app has a alarm for reminding me about the time to get on to the work. If it has that then pls tell me how to access that and if not then pls add a alarm or reminder option in this app.

author: Dr. Safvat
comment: I really like to see how much time left by looking at status bar (notifications) circle icon but it's a ¾ circle static icon. Add this features please, it's very useful on Galaxy Always On Display.
Can't change the timer. No AMOLED mode, so that I can keep my screen on without battery drain. Currently, I'm sticking with Goodtime.

reply.author: Francisco Franco
reply.content: Hi. Version 4.0 has an option for custom timers. 5217 has a screensaver feature which is exactly for the "AMOLED" mode you're asking for.

author: Gowtham Chitipolu
comment: Hey ! Can you add some feature snooze the break time for 5 to 10 minutes.

author: Ronish Satapathy
comment: Amazing! One thing which could be added is being able to choose our own audio files as notification tones.

author: Giuseppe C
comment: It does one thing and it does it extremely well. It even turns on dnd mode while you're working, if that's what you want.

reply.author: Francisco Franco
reply.content: Hi Giuseppe. Really glad you like 5217, thanks!

author: ArJuN AJ
comment: Such a simple app, so much power. One request could you show a timer too on the andoird wear companion app.

author: Epicbob03
comment: It's great makes me get on with my homework. Great for school and for when you work!

author: Ian Cox
comment: Excellent, easy to use app. I'm glad that I found it. Thank you for developing it.

reply.author: Francisco Franco
reply.content: Hi Ian. Really glad you like 5217, thanks!

comment: Just a great app for focussed study!! Helped me a lot

author: Brian Sammon
comment: Great productivity app, simple design and nicely implemented.

comment: Missing pause button. Overall a nice app!

comment: This app is simply brilliant. Be productive again.

comment: totaly good app best for students

reply.content: Hi Darshil. Really glad you like 5217, thanks!

author: Nикита Кабаков
comment: Well designed and easy to use

comment: Use this app daily. Amazing.

reply.author: Francisco Franco
reply.content: Hi Amila. Really glad you like 5217, thanks!

author: Eric Sampson
comment: Great app!

author: Aldo Skenderi
comment: Really helpful

author: Jeorge Trinidad
comment: It's fine

author: First Last
comment: This app is a good idea, but it would be better if the screen could be dimmed to black so we can save power while being able to check the time on AMOLED. It would also be good if we could start the break before the work. Probably not too great for motivation but there could be reasons. And an early break (to eat or so on) is not too unreasonable.

reply.author: Francisco Franco
reply.content: Hi. 5217 has a screensaver feature which does exactly what you asked for.

author: Pranav Rai
comment: Does what it claims, and does it better than any other app I have used. Alternating 52 minute and 17 minute sessions for work and rest. And if you sync it with your work pc, say using pushbullet, you get exactly 1 notification to switch between the cycles with no distractions in between. No fluff, clean design, reliable. 5 stars.
